intro: Cracca remotiflora, commonly known as the remote-flowered cracca, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
